text: The Wyandotte Constitution is the constitution of the U.S state of Kansas. The constitution said that Kansas would be a state without slavery. However, the constitution did not give black people, women or Native Americans the right to vote. The Wyandotte Constitution was passed by a vote of 10,421 to 5,530 on October 4, 1859. ==References== Category:1859 in the United States Category:History of Kansas Category:State constitutions of the United States Category:1850s in Kansas
title: Wyandotte Constitution
